content: The Office of External Affairs and Linkages actively participated in the 3rd National Peace Education Summit, which was conducted virtually. This significant event served as a strategic platform for the university to connect with prominent stakeholders in the field of peace education, including educators, government agencies, civil society organizations, and peace advocates from across the country.

The summit provided a comprehensive learning environment that highlighted best practices in peacebuilding, conflict resolution, and the promotion of a culture of peace. Through a series of presentations, workshops, and panel discussions, participants were able to deepen their understanding of critical themes such as conflict transformation, human rights, and sustainable development.

By engaging in this national dialogue, the university reaffirmed its commitment to integrating peace education into its academic and outreach programs. The summit also opened avenues for future partnerships and collaborative initiatives that will strengthen the institution’s role in advancing peace and social justice at both local and national levels.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: To engage with national stakeholders in peace education to foster partnerships and collaborative initiatives that promote a culture of peace.
To gain insights into best practices in peacebuilding, conflict transformation, and conflict resolution through participation in presentations, workshops, and discussions.
To enhance the university’s capacity to integrate peace education, human rights, and sustainable development principles into its academic and community engagement programs.
To contribute to national dialogue on peace education by sharing institutional experiences and exploring innovative approaches to fostering peaceful and inclusive societies.
To identify opportunities for future collaboration and linkages with academic institutions, civil society organizations, and government agencies involved in peace advocacy and education.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The participation of The Office of External Affairs and Linkages in the 3rd National Peace Education Summit significantly contributed to the advancement of the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), particularly SDG 4 (Quality Education), SDG 16 (Peace, Justice, and Strong Institutions), and SDG 17 (Partnerships for the Goals). By engaging in discussions and workshops focused on peace education, human rights, and conflict resolution, the university reinforced its commitment to providing inclusive and equitable quality education that promotes lifelong learning opportunities. The summit also emphasized the importance of building peaceful, just, and inclusive societies, aligning closely with efforts to reduce violence, promote the rule of law, and ensure access to justice for all. Furthermore, the event created opportunities for collaboration with various stakeholders, strengthening partnerships that are essential for achieving sustainable development. Through its active involvement, the university demonstrated its role as a proactive agent in fostering peace and sustainable progress both within and beyond the academic community.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The participation of The Office of External Affairs and Linkages in the 3rd National Peace Education Summit was a highly valuable experience that enriched the university’s understanding and engagement in peace education. The summit provided meaningful opportunities to learn about innovative peacebuilding practices and current trends in conflict resolution, which are essential for enhancing the university’s academic and community programs. Interaction with diverse stakeholders fostered new partnerships and collaborative possibilities, strengthening the university’s network within the peace education sector. Overall, the activity successfully aligned with the university’s goals to promote social justice, human rights, and sustainable development, and it laid a solid foundation for continued involvement in national peace initiatives. Moving forward, the insights gained from the summit are expected to inform the design of more impactful peace education activities and linkages.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: Based on the outcomes of the summit, it is recommended that the university strengthen the integration of peace education principles and best practices into its curriculum and community outreach programs to further promote a culture of peace. Active collaboration with other participating organizations, government agencies, and civil society groups should be pursued to develop joint peacebuilding initiatives and broaden the impact of these efforts. Additionally, the university should invest in regular capacity-building activities such as training and workshops for faculty, staff, and students to deepen their knowledge in conflict resolution, human rights, and sustainable development. Increasing awareness through campus-wide campaigns and events will also be vital in fostering a shared commitment to peace and social cohesion. Lastly, sustaining participation in future national and regional peace education summits is essential to keep abreast of emerging trends and to maintain the university’s active role in the broader peace education community.

title: BRILGE: Building Resources for Inclusive Legal Guidance and Empowerment

content: Recognizing the vital need for accessible legal support, Urdaneta City University (UCU) proudly introduces BRILGE: Building Resources for Inclusive Legal Guidance and Empowerment, a dedicated legal aid caravan providing essential legal services to the entire campus community. BRILGE empowers students, faculty, and staff by offering free legal consultations, workshops, and resources that simplify the legal system and foster understanding of individual rights. Held at the UCU Gymnasium, this initiative creates a welcoming space where participants can interact with legal professionals, ask questions, and gain the knowledge needed to make informed decisions. Through partnerships with local legal aid organizations, law students, and community advocates, BRILGE aims to eliminate barriers to legal access, emphasizing that everyone deserves the opportunity to understand their rights and receive guidance on issues ranging from academic integrity to housing and consumer rights.

sections.title: This projects aims to:
items: Provide free legal consultations to students and staff on common legal issues such as tenancy rights, academic integrity, and consumer rights
Raise awareness about legal rights and resources available to the campus community
Facilitate workshops on legal literacy, focusing on practical skills like contract understanding and conflict resolution.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The BRILGE initiative makes a meaningful impact on several Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), especially Goal 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Institutions, by providing free legal consultations and promoting legal literacy to enhance access to justice and build accountable, inclusive community institutions. It empowers students, faculty, and staff to understand their rights, navigate legal challenges, and engage confidently in civil and institutional processes. Additionally, BRILGE supports Goal 4: Quality Education by integrating legal education through workshops and interactive discussions that develop practical life skills, critical thinking, civic engagement, and ethical decision-making—key elements of holistic education. The program also advances Goal 10: Reduced Inequalities by focusing on legal empowerment for underserved groups who often lack access to professional legal assistance, ensuring inclusivity in understanding and asserting legal rights. Ultimately, BRILGE cultivates a culture of empowerment, accountability, and legal awareness that promotes human rights and equitable development within the university and its broader community.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The BRILGE legal aid caravan was a highly impactful initiative that successfully addressed the need for accessible legal support within the Urdaneta City University community. The program created a safe, inclusive, and informative space where students, faculty, and staff could engage directly with legal professionals, seek guidance on various legal matters, and enhance their understanding of their rights. Participants responded positively to the opportunity to receive free legal consultations, particularly on practical concerns such as academic policies, tenancy issues, and consumer protection. The legal literacy workshops were especially effective in demystifying complex legal topics, equipping attendees with essential skills in contract comprehension, conflict resolution, and rights awareness. The collaboration between university stakeholders, law practitioners, and community partners strengthened the initiative’s credibility and reach. Overall, BRILGE successfully fostered a more informed, empowered campus population and demonstrated the university’s commitment to justice, equity, and service to its community.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To further enhance the effectiveness and sustainability of the BRILGE program, several recommendations are suggested. First, increasing the frequency of the legal aid caravan—such as hosting it quarterly or semi-annually—would allow for continuous support and follow-up on legal concerns. Expanding the scope of services to include more specialized areas, such as family law, labor rights, and cybercrime, could also meet a broader range of legal needs within the university community. It is also recommended to implement a confidential pre-registration system for consultations to manage time effectively and ensure privacy. Additionally, distributing printed or digital legal information materials (e.g., brochures or FAQs) during the event would reinforce learning beyond the sessions. Lastly, involving law students in organizing and assisting during the event could provide valuable experiential learning opportunities while helping scale the program’s reach. These improvements would help BRILGE make a deeper, long-term impact on legal empowerment across the university.
